TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs

remarks.format: ## Remarks The event is raised when an issued token is received from the security token service (STS) during sign-in using WS-Federation. It is raised before the token is validated. You can access the issued token through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.SecurityToken%2A> property and modify its properties or replace it. You can cancel sign-in processing by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken securityToken) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the new instance, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.SecurityToken%2A> property is set to the token specified by the `securityToken` parameter and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.SignInContext%2A> property is set to `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken securityToken, string signInContext) cil managed

Docs.param: The sign-in context specified in the control.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified security token and sign-in context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the new instance, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.SecurityToken%2A> property is set to the token specified by the `securityToken` parameter and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.SignInContext%2A> property is set to the value of the `signInContext` property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the issued security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can either modify the properties of the issued security token or replace it entirely.

Docs.summary: Gets the sign-in context specified in the control.
